metadata.title: CVE-2017-15422 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Integer overflow in international date handling in International Componentsfor Unicode (ICU) for C/C++ before 60.1, as used in V8 in Google Chromeprior to 63.0.3239.84 and other products, allowed a remote attacker toperform an out of bounds memory read via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15422` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libicu55 - 55.1-7ubuntu0.4
No subscription required

chromium-browser - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: icu package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '55.1-7ubuntu0.4').
chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
